body.p:
To Hon Thomas E. Bramlet
Govenor of the Comlth of Ky.

Your Petitioners represent to your Excellency that at the term of the Allen Equity & Criminal Court 1861 there was a Judgement rendered agst one Dilingham Myze of this county for the sum of thirty five Dollars with costs from a charge of a Breech of the Pease We represent that we have known Mr Myze for several years and that he is a quiet good citizen and is not in the habit of getting into difficulties but is a very peaceable man We know that he ought not in Justice to himself & family be required to pay the fine referred to. We believe the difficulty into which he was thrown was not induced upon his part. He is a very poor man & has a large family with a widowed mother to support who has lost one son in the service of the U. S. & has an other and only son except said Dillingham servd in the Union Army. Your Petitioners think that if there was ever a case that requires the interposition of the Executive clemency this is certainly one

J A C Streine
George Mitchell
Willis Spann
G. D. Bear
Sasey W. Justice
Jno G. Gatewood
J W Heeter
J. H. Murray s. a. c
